author: {'steamid': '76561198316166388', 'num_games_owned': 146, 'num_reviews': 30, 'playtime_forever': 891, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 891, 'last_played': 1701703883}
review: A masterpiece. Although as a game in 2013, it seems simple and outdated compared to newer games. However, the story is well-worthy.

author: {'steamid': '76561199142628066', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 1806, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1723, 'last_played': 1692041760}
review:
IF i want to recommend a the best visual novel anyone should its this one,

The reasons are NOT personal, its from what I have seen in the game.

Pros:
1- This game does not have any sexual(content and harrasment), inappropriate scenes, or even seduction although its a dating sim unlike other dating sim games, which makes it appropriate for most ages!!

2- This game is emotional more than its romantic

3- The soundtrack used is very rare(Referring to its style and way)

4- Story is well written and motivating! You cant get from your seat before seeing some parts.

5- No bad language used(e.g f**k, b**th and so on)

Cons:
1- Games like Area-x are hard to find nowadays(Referring to clean dating sims without inappropriate scenes)

2- In one of the characters paths, there are some(but not many) scenes of alcohols which may be inappropriate for some people

Please note that all pros and cons stated are based on my experience and its not in general. Dont make the cons i saw interfere you neither the pros i saw grab you. For me, trying it is best than watching it on youtube

author: {'steamid': '76561198432310146', 'num_games_owned': 478, 'num_reviews': 218, 'playtime_forever': 1586, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1586, 'last_played': 1675594668}
review:
[h1] 科幻类时间旅行乙女游[/h1]

故事背景：在遥远的未来，人类生活在地下拥有发达的技术但资源匮乏，某组织试图通过让回到过去恢复失去的自然资源来改变现状。女主Elcia便是时间旅行者之一，她负责跨越各个维度的时空与过去的人交流谈判。

通俗点说女主就是[u] 时空管理局一名为完成任务不停穿越时间的小员工。 [/u]

世界观里一些小设定在与路人对话时得以补充，比如穿越时空的原理，设备用的什么材料啊，性能是什么之类的，这些偏理科且令读者感到严谨的伪科学设定在乙女游是种新尝试。

女主性格极度讨喜！属于鬼灵精怪一言不合暴力伺候的女汉子，某人线里还把[spoiler] 地下城 [/spoiler]最大的电力网给炸了。
[hr][/hr]
Belph
腹黑抖S，负责女主时空穿越接线员
换成国内更熟悉的身份——穿越小说里的系统[strike] （当然真实身份到个人线才会揭开） [/strike]。
[spoiler]跟所有攻略对象碰面后，回来公司被毁闺蜜被杀，为了找寻凶手，Elcia展开了行动，好奇心害死猫， [/spoiler]想着调查案件结果毫不意外进了Belph的线，这条线解释了[spoiler] ORZ公司的黑暗面以及造成地表高辐射无法生存的罪魁祸首 [/spoiler]。Belph是[spoiler] ORZ公司派来的间谍，也是ORZ公司未来继承人 [/spoiler]，和儿时的Elcia有过一面之缘。
毫不意外进入BE（没攻略我就是BE狂魔），在指南找到了攻略才玩出HE。

Yuras
冰河世纪篇男主，沉着冷静小正太
Yuras线梦回打越的极限脱出，居然让我输入在Belph线里刀ORZ公司调查时获得的密码！？要不是我事先通了Belph线，这不就卡关了！？
没想到在Yuras线居然吃到Belph的刀子，Elcia要是没去找他，[spoiler] 他走歪路后遭遇令人心疼（被逼疯后毁灭世界），造成进入冰河时代的罪魁祸首也是他，其实冰河时代是Elcia所处世界的未来并非遥远的过去 [/spoiler]。

Rexus
过去篇男主。
不会撒谎易脸红的纯情耿直Boy。
本作GB感最强的一对。
反向壁咚捂嘴躲人，英雄救美未成反被调戏，女主爱恶作剧的小恶魔性格太讨人喜欢了，骗Rexus到黑暗料理店被吃晕过去，骗他去食人鱼出没的许愿喷泉投币。这对相处总是充满欢声笑语。
初登场一股不良头子即视感，[spoiler] 其实是女主的老板（Belph的上司） [/spoiler]，被女主遗忘的青梅竹马，[spoiler] 时光机的发明者， [/spoiler]老实人不会说谎进线没过多久就被女主炸出了身份。

Livan
欧洲中世纪篇男主，笑里藏刀画家。
绿切黑，另一个被女主遗忘的竹马。
[strike] BE原本治愈搞笑的日常生活秒变恐怖绝望故事… [/strike]
神奇的是这条线女主居然没有使用暴力变成了淑女，全程都在逃跑…
好家伙，原来是你[spoiler] 杀了女主的闺蜜！好感暴跌。 [/spoiler]
[spoiler] 经典“没有你（女主）活着的世界毫无存在意义”反派言论（放在乙游就是官配），因为一场雪崩，Elcia的母亲收留的小孩和Elcia全部死于非命，除了Livan幸存，他拿着Elcia手中的宝珠许愿创造了一个Elcia还活着的世界，但Livan的力量不足以支撑世界的运转，残缺的世界时刻面临分离瓦解，需要女主Elcia的力量稳定这个世界，但这样的代价就是Elcia用尽力量消失（就像Rexus线ME那样）。Livan为了避免Elcia频繁穿越时空，除去一切干扰因素，穿到未来杀了阻止他破坏时光机的闺蜜。 [/spoiler]
应该是官配，但他对[spoiler] 闺蜜 [/spoiler]造成的伤害给我留下非常不好的印象，[spoiler] 闺蜜无辜躺枪还被他当工具人，骗闺蜜感情，即使他再怎么喜欢女主为她着想牺牲 [/spoiler]，这做法太过分了……

Ferim
area-x的管理者。
真相线，TE？
Ferim从无心到有心的过程，[spoiler] 在Livan创造出新世界的同时他诞生了，为了修复扭曲的时间，他抢占Livan的肉体，在各个时空中寻找Elcia（期间遇到了Yuras的哥哥真正的Ferim），并帮助幼年的Elcia从实验室逃亡，之后一直在x区域看着女主的成长和选择，在监视女主并和她相处的过程，逐渐读懂爱，产生了人性，哪怕微乎其微的可能性，也愿意赌一把让女主活下来，纵使牺牲自己。 [/spoiler]
结局有些意难平，喜忧参半。
前面的伏笔一并回收，五个时空的[spoiler] 整合重组 [/spoiler]加上[spoiler]Ferim 的牺牲一气呵成， [/spoiler]可惜Ferim和Elcia相处时间太短了，而且有一部分伏笔没回收有些遗憾。
[hr][/hr]
题材极其少见的乙游，几乎无代餐，通关下来我最喜欢Rexus，最好按照攻略顺序走，至少要先攻略Belph拿到密码再走Yuras。看官网会有第三作Slient-x，但作者推特已经两年没更新了，我极度怀疑项目是不是凉了[strike] （拒绝有生之年系列）[/strike]。

author: {'steamid': '76561199014470468', 'num_games_owned': 272, 'num_reviews': 20, 'playtime_forever': 1763, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1261, 'last_played': 1697375293}
review:

在b站做了一个测评，有兴趣的可以看看https://www.bilibili.com/video/BV1xG4y1u772/?spm_id_from=333.999.0.0。我的评价：10/10，今年最喜欢的乙游之一，打完灵魂升华。

author: {'steamid': '76561198820709085', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 14, 'playtime_forever': 1533, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1066, 'last_played': 1651454362}
review:
Да! Очень уникальная игра, которая затягивает своей атмосферой. Здесь особый упор на сюжет, за которым весьма интересно наблюдать, романтики практически нет, что меня особо порадовало. Понравилась гг и некоторые персонажи. Однозначно стала одной из любимых отомех из-за своей оригинальности и нешаблонности. Прошла ее от и до 2 раза (что для меня впервые)!
Из минусов могу выделить ограниченное количество эмоций на спрайтах персонажей.
В этой игре заметно, насколько автор прокачалась в разработке ВН, потому что все в ней в разы лучше, чем в X Note.

author: {'steamid': '76561198237176692', 'num_games_owned': 292, 'num_reviews': 43, 'playtime_forever': 908, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 723, 'last_played': 1650132301}
review:
I write this review as I finish my 4th ending (don't get my playtime wrong, I had this open while AFK).

The game is a little confusing at first, specially with the choices you make. Like, talking to a bartender can change whether you get the good or the bad ending so it is like, if you don't follow a guide, you will be stuck a long time on the bad ending (the company made one, it is available here http://www.zeiva.net/otome/area_x_guide.html ).

There are some things the game itself does not explain to you. Like, when you reach an ending, you get a message saying something about SEA or SKY path so let me explain to you. Once you finish Belph & Yuras both good and bad endings, you complete a word that is a password to get to the SEA path which allows you to play both Livan & Rexus path (which I haven't done at the time of writting this review) but it is actually easy to do.

Now, about the story itself. I like it a lot, I have always liked time travel novels and this one is mixed with otome! It is not the best, it has its flaw sometimes but this is truly an underrated masterpiece.

10/10 totally recommended if you like otomes. What are you waiting for?

author: {'steamid': '76561198275931064', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 115, 'playtime_forever': 517, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 513, 'last_played': 1678361661}
review:
Zeiva not kidding when they said this is their own masterpiece. Area-X is their best game EVER.

Pros
We have character change their outfit through the story, which not much game have it.
The flash engine is not pleasant to play for sure. But it system do improve A WHOLE LOT compare to the first version they put out, when we didn't have skip! (and wayyy back then when X-Note didn't even have save feature for god sake!)
A good protagonist which is witty, smart, hilarious and super charming.
Great story for both mystery and emotional.

Cons
I do understand why ppl find it kinda pricey, it a little short compare to it price indeed.
We can't hide the user interfact for the sake of having a clear CG.
We have to replay the last route just for the sake of bonus scene, which I don't understand why they have to locked it??? I really don't see the point of it.

Overall, you may want wait for the sale but don't skip this game if you are a mystery otome fan.

author: {'steamid': '76561198205145671', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 7, 'playtime_forever': 2981, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1564, 'last_played': 1709387011}
review:
I found the game demo in Y8, since the thumbnail look interesting, I played the game. It is certainly intriguing as there is time travel and mystery. I finally bought the game in a discount rate. 

Area-X is the first visual novel game I have played with no spoilers due to little information to provide, it has a intriguing story and lore I can followed. Although the path system confused me but I got the hang of it. The music, although royalty free, is amazing with my favourite being the bad ending theme, it is so sad. Although the puzzle is confusing when first playing, I have to look through the guide to pass through.

The main key of the game is the story itself and it is amazing, a lot of plot twists and ties between each plot point, like a puzzle fitting with each piece. It made me buy X-Note to complete a portion of the Present story.

In conclusion, I like the game and I recommend people to buy it.

author: {'steamid': '76561198308457838', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 8, 'playtime_forever': 345, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1496651673}
review: Second time buying this. Found this a long time ago actually, back when the first one was made (something about a psychic girl and whatnot-- I forget the title), but I was too young to purchase anything then. Your games were literally my introduction to the otome genre, and I regret nothing! I bought Area-X awhile back but somehow lost it. I bought it again for my best boy Yuras (since I'm a sucker for boys who suffer from circumstances they can't change) and boy do I love this game. Of course I'm smitten with the other boys, but I only remembered Yuras's name so ... please keep up the good work! You can say I'm a loyal fan hahaha

author: {'steamid': '76561198286976300', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 1270, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1270, 'last_played': 1537135807}
review:
I randomly found the demo for this game online a few years ago and was hooked. I purchased the game immediately and it did not disappoint. It was the first adventure visual novel I played. It's funny, the character designs are interesting, I adore the love interests, the music was perfect in setting every scene and the story is really good. 

My only complaint would be that it's hard to determine which choice option leads to a bad ending. Even when you can see on the graph when you've reached a bad ending. I know Zeiva Inc. games are known for having you reach bad endings when you don't use a guide but I don't consider this a positive thing. Good endings shouldn't be hard to achieve. But I suppose that's just my personal opinion. 

I think the game is worth it's price for the content you get. So I recommend it!

author: {'steamid': '76561198188896894', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 3, 'playtime_forever': 1189, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1034, 'last_played': 1617531576}
review:
My personal feelings on Area-X: [i]"Yes! One of my favorite visual novels of all time."[/i]

[url=zeiva.net/otome/area_x_game_demo.html]There's a (downloadable/online) demo on the dev's website if you're interested in trying out first.[/url]
[list]
[*]Around 15 hours of reading.
[*]Likeable and interesting characters.
[*]Great story. No, really.
[*]Beautiful art, beautiful backgrounds, beautiful CGs, but sadly undermined by the game's lower resolution (800x600)
[*]Dialogue font might be a bit small.
[*]Unusual controls. You press the down arrow to advance the text (or click on the text box), and hold it down to skip text (both read and unread). You press the up arrow to "roll back" the text, although there are times when it can't do so (can't go back after a transition, choice etc.).
[*]The time-traveling is a story thing, not gameplay, in case you came here hoping for that.
[*]It's also not overtly romantic (Zeiva's games rarely are), so come in with a low romance expectation.
[*]Echoing that it's still a great story regardless of the two points above.
[*]There are puzzles. A lot of them are easy, but some are pretty... tricky? Obscure? What's the word. In any case, [url=zeiva.net/otome/area_x_guide.html]I used the official guide[/url] from the get go so the puzzles never became an obstacle in progressing the story.
[/list]

[b]General tips:[/b]
[list]
[*]On the top of the screen there's that ? button. It brings up a map of the story branches. Every time you make a choice, you progress on it (also other things IIRC, but the choice is the most important one). There's a pattern to the progression and if you take notice of it, you'll be able to tell if you're on your way to the good or bad ending of the route. (Or you can just use the guide.)
[*]So you got the password to access the Extra Gallery? Cool. You don't put it on the base game though, but on the Extra Gallery DLC. It's technically a different game. Different .exe and such. You need to open the game from inside Steam (as in, press that green PLAY button), or you won't get the choice to play the base game or the extra gallery.
[/list]

Bonus: Runs out of the box on Linux using Proton. Though it takes an unholy amount of time to start up for me, for some reasons.

author: {'steamid': '76561198249802978', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 753, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 753, 'last_played': 1549709408}
review:
I originally posted a review somewhere else, but I decided to share my thoughts here too because why not.

Area-X is of the Sci-Fi and Mystery genre with mild romance. More than anything, it focuses around the plot and the main character. There are plenty of comical moments as well though that doesn't mean the game isn't capable of crushing your heart to pieces. Just because it's a good ending doesn't mean it's going to be a happy one.

The game is also connected to X-Note and while it's not necessary to play it, I suggest getting to know a little more about the characters there.

The female protagonist is one of the least uninteresting main character I've ever seen in otome games. She's sassy, cynical, and bit of a sadist who enjoys teasing the hell out of one of her potential love interests. She's a breath of fresh air in otome games filled with dull, "not particularly skilled but still hardworking" MCs. That's not to say it's bad if you actually like them- they're just something I frequently see.

When it came to the love interests, it was a surprise for me to find that I don't dislike any of them. Admittedly, I feel that most of the reasons why I like them in the first place is because of their interactions with Elcia. The dynamics between her and her love interest is so good that I can definitely understand why the guys fell in love (or at least implied it) with her.

In terms of UI, I've gotten used to Ren'Py-based visual novels that I found this one that's akin to a flash game is quite inconvenient. Game codes are given out after finishing a route because it doesn't remember the routes you've finished. On the bright side, the entered code does that for you so you can skip the parts you've already read.

The backgrounds are absolutely gorgeous. The art style suits the game just right. I may have a small gripe about people's fashion sense in the Future dimension though. 

But despite its drawbacks, I highly recommend playing this game. Sure it didn't have enough romance, but in my opinion the game makes up for it with its story.

author: {'steamid': '76561198171878618', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 10, 'playtime_forever': 650, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 208, 'last_played': 1543535481}
review:
I just reviewd the first game of the series X-Note so I felt I should do the same for this one as I may have enjoyed this one even more than the first game despite having played through each route three times in the other one and only one and a half on this one, half is me being generous because I've only played through two of the five guys' routes. (Don't let the time fool you I played this before it was on steam) I really should replay all of them though because the characters are just as great as the story it's self. 

I talked about how the art first drew me to X-Note in my other review and the artwork is still amazing but I forgot to mention how much I enjoyed just listening to it as well. This goes for both games in this series I could rewatch the opening sequence over and over just for that alone. 

Now the only thing I could say negatively about the game would be the mini-games I didn't hate them but I didn't care for them either though they didn't frustrate me like X-Note's did so that's a plus. I truely don't think that takes anything away from the story though so whether you do or don't find the mini games to be your cup of tea I recomend you try this game out and if you play through all the routes and have played X-Note the whole thing really ends up being one big interconnected story in a way that I just loved. Btw all the boys are awesome in their own way but Yuras is the best and I stand by that all the way!

author: {'steamid': '76561198050637112', 'num_games_owned': 410, 'num_reviews': 109, 'playtime_forever': 1801, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1801, 'last_played': 1535709394}
review:
The aim of the creators by making this game was to make a masterpiece, and without doubt they have achieved it. Probably one of the best VN's i have played- the gameplay requires some tweaking which was necessary in most Zeiva games, but regardless the game is worth every penny. In this VN, you follow Elcia, a sadistic determined girl who has got a job of retrieving resources by time travelling. You are in an age where humanity cannot live except undeground because of nuclear radiation and the limited resources are being depleted. In the game you can travel to various time periods, meet a lot of interesting characters both from X-note and this game itself and recover elements of your lost past.

[h1]Story[/h1]
Story is pretty powerful and philosophical, it gets dark at times and humorous. It picks up various messages in society such as : "Morality is something created by society" or "you survive today to see tomorrow". Each male character route has an important message to be delivered. Since this is the prequel for X-note, you will eventually see in Rexus's route how the story connects and the titbits around the mysterious main character herself is revealed. All routes need to be explored to fully understand the story without flaws. 

[h1]Gameplay[/h1]
I have played a lot of Zeiva games and had complained that how necessary it would be to have an auto-mode for their VN's. When saving the game, the game save slots does not represent the "TIME" of saving which is very annoying. If you have two multiple saves in the same chapter- you won't know which is which. Throughout the game you are presented with interesting puzzles, and sometimes dialogues are very important. It's sometimes vital to check each location multiple times even if there is nothing or even when the character says the same thing. The most interesting part of the gameplay was the choices you have to make to get the good ending- the difficulty is high in that sense. For an example for some characters you should lie and not tell the truth. It all depends on their personality traits. It's also helpful to check the statuses of Elcia since it gives out very important clues. There are many secret endings and easter eggs to be found- and each route (especially Rexus's) can be split into two or three segments. You also require passwords to enter the unlocked routes, which doesn't make sense and you need to keep tab of them. In the sky path, no matter what character you choose there will be easter eggs and a special scenes. After finishing the main route in sky path I believe you will get the password for the bonus content, which is present in a different executable in the file directory for Area-X. The bonus content are very great- i really loved the cute chibi comics. 

[h1]Characters[/h1]
It's been a long time now that VN's have employed weak female characters as the main protagonist. But Area-X, i am happy to say have broken the tradition. Elcia's personality is quite vivid and interesting, she is a sadistic girl who has repressed emotions and is very rebellious. A girl who can stand up for herself as she is a good example for the readers. The other male protagonists too have very interesting personalities, I love all of em except for Belph. The most interesting part of their personalities would be the contrasting opposite elements. For an example the nicest guy can turn psycho, and the most anti-social one can do surprising things. This is not present in most VN's and is a very good way to keep the story interesting. 

[h1]Art and Soundtracks[/h1]
Art is very good but needs polishing of the edges. The soundtracks are also very good just as X-note.

[h1]Overall[h1]
I think for once in my life i loved all characters except one and the story and the multiple endings are totally satisfying. I have every obligation to say that I feel my $8 are totally worth for this game

author: {'steamid': '76561198164972135', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 70, 'playtime_forever': 2234, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1158, 'last_played': 1631097914}
review:
I had played X-Note a long time ago. I remember thinking it was mediocre. I also tried to play the Demo for Area-X but I was intimidated by the puzzles and gave up on it. Many years passed since then and I decided to give Area-X another chance and bought it on Steam. 

I have to say that I didn't regret the decision at all. I found the story better than I remembered it from the Demo. I often get bored with the story when I play otome games, but Area-X managed to keep my interest all the way through. The art looks gorgeous and the characters are all quite interesting. I liked the game so much that I even considered buying X-Note again. (I had lost it when my old PC broke)

However, I also had a couple of problems with the game: a)There was not enough romance. The game mostly focuses on the plot. I think it would be better if there were more romantic moments, b) some of the puzzles were way too hard and impossible to solve without a guide. 

Overall, I would recommend this game but maybe it would be preferable if you played X-note first. There are some things in Area-X that you will not understand without having read X-note. I am not saying that it's impossible to enjoy the story if you haven't read X-note, just that you will not be able to get all of the references.

author: {'steamid': '76561198202559727', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 1771, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1771, 'last_played': 1529623811}
review: Area-X is undeniably my favorite otome game of all time. I've played tons of otome games over the past five years, but none could top this one as my favorite. I loved everything about it. The music is amazing and fits each scene. The art is beautiful and distinct. The plot was intriguing and had me hooked. Each character route was equally satisfying, and each revealed different aspects of the mystery very well. I highly recommend playing through all of them. This is one of the only games in which I loved all of the romances. It's also one of the only games in which I loved the protagonist. I felt all of the feelings playing through this. If I could, I would jump at the chance to experience this for the first time again. 10/10

author: {'steamid': '76561198078973509', 'num_games_owned': 277, 'num_reviews': 15, 'playtime_forever': 1151, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1037, 'last_played': 1520165932}
review:
The game is freaking beautiful. The plot is so thick and intertwined I binged playing this the day iIbought it ;-; It has so many feels urghhhhhh. I think this is by far the best one of Zeiva's games they have made.

****Edit**** 
Playtime: 19.1 hours on a binge from the second it was bought.

I should have added more to this review. I first played Zeiva's games when I was a small kid and encountered the first Other Age on Newgrounds. I couldn't buy anything then but bought this as soon and I had money years later as an adult.

This game's plot and numerous endings are AMAZING and super in-depth. Your choices matter and after unlocking the first few endings completely, they tie into all the other endings with your choice of character. One particular character I did not expect the story line to go the way it did and I BAWLED HARD. It made me so sad, but I was in love!! 

Even with the other character choices who don't seem as important contribute to the main hidden story line that connects with everything. 

This game's plot is like an onion with layers upon layers upon layers.  It still leaves me in awe with how excellent the game was structured.


I have played this game over and over to unlock all the endings and dialogue. Only thing I didn't do was replay each story line with the Sky path. It was just a bit too much for me at the time after binge playing the game so much. I was physically tired, but still loved to play it so much.

This is a very visual novel heavy game with choices. Still to this day in 2021 this game is by far my favorite and I try to replay my favorite path once a year or whenever I want to get a feel for childhood nostalgia.

Overall....Definitely get this game! It is soo worth the money and you will see how hard the developers worked for this game. Plot is lovely, touching and funny dialogue, some hard ot make choices, and easy replayability!

author: {'steamid': '76561198249853896', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 60, 'playtime_forever': 2007, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 2007, 'last_played': 1521843058}
review:
Main game done in a bit more than 30h. Really recommended!
[u]X- Note[/u] is developed. You learn better on characters, like after Yuon’s mom death and before Rexus finds Essi. You’ll  discover Dr Loil Corporation’s plan and the consequence..
I bought it to know how lost natural resources would be recovered but there’s another large matter. 
[u]The revelations[/u] increasing in size are a good motive to play, Rexus route is wonderful as it changes the knowledge and it adds another about X-Note. I did Livan then, thought it would be a simple route but what we learn is awesome.
[b]Peculiar humour:[/b] goes against cliches for a good laugh! The ironic humour like the bad boys who were going to harass us are spanked by us. I like Belph sarcasma, making fun of Irina, the sound of his feet as he flees..  Rexus scrutinising look.. Quaint Master is such a clown as he seduces us heavily, when he’s scolded by his wife. His figure’s way on falling on the carpet! 

The analysis of Belph and Yuras is simple. There are Livan and Ferim more complex. 

[b]Characters artwork, a mask for their true self:[/b] 
Once you see his face you’re surprised knowing the importance of his role.
Lady Memme is a shining beauty with sparkling blue eyes and long plump hair. she looks dreadful with her cobra, knowing her current condition :(
Master Pedoe has feminine features like a homosexual (thin eyelashes), when he gets near Elcia, he’s creepy. Mistrust his bourgeois manner.
Ferim ‘s outfit is serious and rigid like his task he must fulfill. It’s a contrast to his young face. Yuras’s brother looks elegant and peaceful rather than a warrior.
Ciera’s indian outfit as she’s calm, her pose is like she bears the world.

Pedoe Manor [b]music[/b] sounds like a brass band, there’s a voiced trumped I like! “Recollection” track in Rexus route goes well with recalling.”Missing Piece” for a dark truth, “human gridlock” for the eerie catastrophe started and “Nostalgia” for Livan’s sadness to shed a tear.
How sad to hear about the witches’ hunt who could be avoided if they were treated better ;)

UNEXPECTED There are things u see unwell at first like: I thought the murderer is against recovering natural resources but no. The true nature of some characters.
Belph’s path puts apart the Project Recovery but we discover a dirty thing. 

In Rexus path, you’ll learn his origin and why he watches over Essi. At his good ending there’s something heartbreaking about Elcia. At the end of the main game, we didn’t recover natural resources, just cut the after effect of it in an ending. [b]How come Oure projected in the Future? What about the Mirage Fountain mystery? Who said “destroy, destroy!!?[/b]

author: {'steamid': '76561198059350233', 'num_games_owned': 241, 'num_reviews': 19, 'playtime_forever': 117, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'last_played': 1488067154}
review:
If someone asked me for visual novel reccomedations, this would be right at the top of my list. Otome or not, don't let the label put you off. The plot and the way it is interwoven with each route and the characters, I really can't say much without spoling things but just, wow 10/10. Incredibly creative and emotionally engaging. Sucks you in with a light and offbeat tone but don't be fooled. Please play this game! If you've never played a visual novel this is a great place to start. If not the best!

(I played this in offline mode, hence the lack of hours. I think it's about 15+ hours? And honestly I'll be replaying it again and from the look of other reviewers I am not alone)

author: {'steamid': '76561198168726364', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 4, 'playtime_forever': 634, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 540, 'last_played': 1498328225}
review:
I really liked this game! It's the only otome I've played where I'd say it WOULD be worth it to play for story and not just the dating aspect. The boys are really cute too! I still need to replay to see a couple extra scenes but I've already finished every route. 

Pros:
-Immersive story
-Well written plot
-Strong female protagonist (crazy rare in VNs!)
-Avoids cliches and tropes
-Beautiful artwork
-Unlockable skip scene option to make replays faster

Cons:
-No skip read option (I've played another game my this studio and it seems that this might be true for all their games, they have a skip function but not option to only skip read text)
-Mediocre music
-Short (this game is absolutely worth it on sale though!)

author: {'steamid': '76561198111351391', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 5, 'playtime_forever': 348, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 345, 'last_played': 1468729445}
review: I loved this game. The graphics are great, the story and mystery and unfolding myster are incredibly engaging, and the music offers a nice compliment. Definitely one of my favorites, and well worth the money. Looking forward to another play through to find the endings I've missed.

author: {'steamid': '76561198210285493', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1, 'playtime_forever': 831, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 696, 'last_played': 1462695811}
review:
WORTH EVERY CENT. 

Pros:
-Romanceable characters are not simple card board cut outs, each have depth.
-All characters are integral to the overall story. All pursuable characters have a role in the story and thereby cannot be taken out.
-Well thought out story that have little to no plot holes.
-art is fantastic

-If you've played X-note, all your answers can be found here.
-Even w/o playing X-note, you can still play the game as a stand alone.

Cons
-For most, the price will be a hurdle espcially since there are not even voices. However, given the cohesion of the story and amazing writing/story telling, I do not regret paying at full price.
-Lack of romance. There is a MUCH greater focus on the plot. 

+/- not a fluffy otome game. Plot driven with more emotional/ serious undertones. 
+/- has minigames. I honestly wasn't too fond of them since I found most puzzles to be quite difficult and required a walkthough. 

Area-X is one of my favorite otome games and (I know I sound like a broken record) a story that is so well developed, carefully planned, and intriguing that the price is worth it. If you've become jaded with otome games (mobile, pc, etc) do give this is a try. You will witness what a visual novel is truly capable of.

author: {'steamid': '76561198084101505', 'num_games_owned': 372, 'num_reviews': 80, 'playtime_forever': 309, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 309, 'last_played': 1437940917}
review:
Area-X is the sequel to X-note, it contains most of the gameplay aspects and elements from the previous VN. 

[h1]Graphics[/h1]
The graphics in this VN is pretty much the same as the previous VN which I liked a lot. I was glad that the graphics stayed the same as I truly liked it the last time. 
[h1] Score: 10[/h1]

[h1]Storyline[/h1]
This VN delivered such an amazing mystery story just like X-note. There are some puzzles to complete to progress in the story, but they aren't too hard to do. 
[h1]Score: 10[/h1]

[h1]Sound[/h1]
The soundtrack definitely improved from the last game, which I was pleased about. The soundtracks seemed more appropriate in this VN and the soundtracks did not seem to repeat itself quite as often, but it still isn't top-notch soundtrack and there was no option for any kind of volume control in the "Options". 
[h1]Score: 7[/h1]

[h1]Structure[/h1]
The artwork and the storyline make an awesome combination, the soundtrack was certainly improved, but I don't feel like it was enough. The "Options" menu barely had anything to change, there was no option to change the volume...it was either ON or OFF and there no other "text" options. Also, just like X-note, there is only 15 save slots which I feel isn't enough if someone is going to do all the 9 routes. 
[h1]Score: 8[/h1]

[h1]Price[/h1]
For £18.99, this VN is over-priced just like the X-note. I would've liked to see the price reduced to at least £10 as it’s too expensive right now...
[h1]Score: 5 [/h1]

Overall Verdict: The VN has amazing artwork, a great story and a decent soundtrack going for it, but the lack of options in the "options" menu, save slots and the price might be the only aspects keeping this VN down.

I totally recommend reading this VN if you have the money for it or you could just wait until it goes on sale.

author: {'steamid': '76561198065942019', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 61, 'playtime_forever': 514, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 179, 'last_played': 1437681060}
review:
Really good game with a very original idea and I love it - but just to break it a bit down, here are my personal pros and cons for it.

PROS:
- TIME TRAVEL!!
- The art for this game, though not perfect, is gorgeous. Not just the CGs and character portraits/sprites, but the backgrounds and animation as well ( I also liked that the main-heroine really gets a costume change for every era she goes to ). while there are some backgrounds in the game that might seem more simple than others, I still give a lot of points to Zeiva because they're definitely not free from stock images which means that they took the time to make everything original, and theirs.
- Really fun, cool, different and spicy heroine to play as (instead of always playing the dense and naive innocent girl)
- I personally love that each character got their own BGM.
- The puzzles are fun and different everytime, also they require some thought.
- There is a lot of characters in this game, all with their own charms.
- fans of X-Note might be happy to hear that there are more than a few familiar faces.

CONS:
- To get back on the topic of the puzzles, I did sometimes find myself guessing more, than finding it out.
- For an otome game, I do find it to lack a bit more of romantic sessions. So I would warn, fellow otome lovers, that buying this game, you will get a story that focuses a bit more on the mystery and character development than romance.

But all in all, I found it to be an awesome game. I had great fun playing it, Elcia (the heroine) made it more interesting and the rest of the Characters just added more spice to the story really. All in all I would rate it something like 9,2? (considering  the few drawbacks I meantioned)

author: {'steamid': '76561198036328170', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1688, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1688, 'last_played': 1436748224}
review:
Area-X has a pretty complex storyline with a ton of endings that can be reached. Each major branch of the storyline is quite different from the others, so players aren't repeating so much of the same story as they play through multiple times. Area-X is definitely a game you will want to play through over and over, as more of the story is unlocked and more of the mystery is unravelled with each different completetion. Really, the game doesn't get started until you complete the first four basic endings, and then there is still a lot left to experience. The replay factor for this game is huge, and grinders who love to take a Visual Novel to its full extent will be fully satisfied by this game.

Elcia is a really strong female protaganist with a bit of a sadistic streak to her. Still, she is able to make connections with the other characters in the game, and some of the endings are super sweet. The game isn't about hooking up with the various characters or even finding true love. Some of the endings are more about making a special connection with a character, and the endings are really rewarding.

The writing for Area-X could be a little better, but as the writers have done a ton of work for this very long game, some players might be willing to accept some of the weaker parts of the story and move on. 

Overall, if you can get past some cheesy writing at a few points and press the "I believe" button at a few story elements, this game can be a lot of fun. Hard core VN players who love to experience every scene and ending will be rewarded with Area-X, and those same players should find that they certainly got their money's worth out of this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561197997172478', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 1013, 'playtime_forever': 290, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 290, 'last_played': 1436314044}
review: This game was more than worth the $25 I paid for it and if I could give it full marks in good conscience, I would. It  has officially joined the ranks of the few OELVNs I'd definitely recommend to people if someone asks me to recommend an English otome game. All of the love interests are endearing in their own way and Elcia is a wonderful heroine, I couldn't help but adore this game.

author: {'steamid': '76561198068097401', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 24, 'playtime_forever': 1820, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1371, 'last_played': 1465132266}
review:
I just finished my first play through of this game and I'm telling you right now - this game is worth every penny. It's absoultely stunning; the author and artist should be extremely proud of themselves. 

Firstly, the art is beautiful. The animated eyes can look a little awkward on some characters, but overall everything is drawn in lovely detail; the characters are distinct and the backgrounds are never lazy. Then there's the music, which is sort of techno in style; it suits the game and the mood. Personally, I'd buy the sound-track if I could.

The story is engaging, interesting and well-written. Despite finishing only today, I'm already hungry for more. There's still so much mystery left, so many characters arcs I haven't explored. I felt for the characters. Some of them were very unique - in particular, I appericated Elcia, who isn't the stereotypical, sweet and loving otome protagonist.

Edit: I previously wrote here you cannot skip text, but this isn't true! Holding the down arrow allows you to fly through text. Also, you can press Enter to skip whole segments of the game after you've progressed to a certain point.

I'll also add that "romances" in this game are restricted to male/female couples, so no female love interests. In addition, none of the romances get too, well, "romancy", if that's what you're looking for. There's no declarations of eternal love, passionate kissing or desperate hugs - the affectionation between Elcia and the boys can be interpretted as romantic, platonic or queerplatonic, which I particularly liked.

Do yourself a favour and buy this game!

author: {'steamid': '76561198052385248', 'num_games_owned': 0, 'num_reviews': 32, 'playtime_forever': 1491, 'playtime_last_two_weeks': 0, 'playtime_at_review': 1033, 'last_played': 1436837627}
review:
HIGHLY RECOMMENDED


One of the best VN I had the pleasure to play. 

The Story is very well written  and engaging.  
Each character and path will make you go through different emotion.( Keep Tissues close by)
The excellent music  helps to make you feel what you are reading.


Play Time  15 Hrs. ( Using sometimes a walkthrough)\

Worth the asking price.  Will Replay again.


10/10
